meanings.definition: A small hook or hook-like structure.
meanings.sent1: The uncini on the plant help it climb up the trellis.
meanings.sent2: She used the uncini to hang her keys on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel got its tail stuck on the uncini of the fence.
meanings.sent4: His words had uncini that grabbed the attention of the audience.
meanings.sent5: The uncini on the fishing line caught a big fish.

meanings.definition: A type of bristle found on certain animals.
meanings.sent1: The cat's uncini were soft and fluffy.
meanings.sent2: The uncini on the hedgehog protected it from predators.
meanings.sent3: The dog's uncini tickled my hand when I petted it.
meanings.sent4: The uncini of the porcupine were like tiny needles.
meanings.sent5: The uncini of the boar were sharp and dangerous.

meanings.definition: A type of appendage or projection.
meanings.sent1: The uncini on the microscope helped in precise measurements.
meanings.sent2: The uncini on the insect's legs allowed it to grip surfaces.
meanings.sent3: The uncini on the robot's arms made it look like a futuristic machine.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas had uncini that reached out and touched people's hearts.
meanings.sent5: The uncini on the tree branches swayed gently in the breeze.
